00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 
00003 #ifndef DatumLibraryImplementation_H
00004 #define DatumLibraryImplementation_H
00005 
00006 /***************************************************************************/
00007 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: Datum Library
00008  *
00009  * ABSTRACT
00010  *
00011  *    This component provides datum shifts for a large collection of local
00012  *    datums, WGS72, and WGS84.  A particular datum can be accessed by using its
00013  *    standard 5-letter code to find its index in the datum table.  The index
00014  *    can then be used to retrieve the name, type, ellipsoid code, and datum
00015  *    shift parameters, and to perform shifts to or from that datum.
00016  *
00017  *    By sequentially retrieving all of the datum codes and/or names, a menu
00018  *    of the available datums can be constructed.  The index values resulting
00019  *    from selections from this menu can then be used to access the parameters
00020  *    of the selected datum, or to perform datum shifts involving that datum.
00021  *
00022  *    This component supports both 3-parameter local datums, for which only X,
00023  *    Y, and Z translations relative to WGS 84 have been defined, and
00024  *    7-parameter local datums, for which X, Y, and Z rotations, and a scale
00025  *    factor, are also defined.  It also includes entries for WGS 84 (with an
00026  *    index of 0), and WGS 72 (with an index of 1), but no shift parameter
00027  *    values are defined for these.
00028  *
00029  *    This component provides datum shift functions for both geocentric and
00030  *    geodetic coordinates.  WGS84 is used as an intermediate state when
00031  *    shifting from one local datum to another.  When geodetic coordinates are
00032  *    given Molodensky's method is used, except near the poles where the 3-step
00033  *    step method is used instead.  Specific algorithms are used for shifting
00034  *    between WGS72 and WGS84.
00035  *
00036  *    This component depends on two data files, named 3_param.dat and
00037  *    7_param.dat, which contain the datum parameter values.  Copies of these
00038  *    files must be located in the directory specified by the value of the
00039  *    environment variable "MSPCCS_DATA", if defined, or else in the current
00040  *    directory whenever a program containing this component is executed.
00041  *
00042  *    Additional datums can be added to these files, either manually or using
00043  *    the Create_Datum function.  However, if a large number of datums are
00044  *    added, the datum table array sizes in this component will have to be
00045  *    increased.
00046  *
00047  *    This component depends on two other components: the Ellipsoid component
00048  *    for access to ellipsoid parameters; and the Geocentric component for
00049  *    conversions between geodetic and geocentric coordinates.
00050  *
00051  * ERROR HANDLING
00052  *
00053  *    This component checks for input file errors and input parameter errors.
00054  *    If an invalid value is found, the error code is combined with the current
00055  *    error code using the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error
00056  *    codes to be returned. The possible error codes are:
00057  *
00058  *  DATUM_NO_ERROR                  : No errors occurred in function
00059  *  DATUM_NOT_INITIALIZED_ERROR     : Datum module has not been initialized
00060  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 7 parameter file opening error
00061  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 7 parameter file structure error
00062  *  DATUM_7PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 7 parameter table overflow
00063  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 3 parameter file opening error
00064  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 3 parameter file structure error
00065  *  DATUM_3PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 3 parameter table overflow
00066  *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR       : Index out of valid range (less than one
00067  *                                      or more than Number_of_Datums)
00068  *  DATUM_INVALID_SRC_INDEX_ERROR   : Source datum index invalid
00069  *  DATUM_INVALID_DEST_INDEX_ERROR  : Destination datum index invalid
00070  *  DATUM_INVALID_CODE_ERROR        : Datum code not found in table
00071  *  DATUM_LAT_ERROR                 : Latitude out of valid range (-90 to 90)
00072  *  DATUM_LON_ERROR                 : Longitude out of valid range (-180 to
00073  *                                    360)
00074  *  DATUM_SIGMA_ERROR               : Standard error values must be positive
00075  *                                    (or -1 if unknown)
00076  *  DATUM_DOMAIN_ERROR              : Domain of validity not well defined
00077  *  DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR             : Error in ellipsoid module
00078  *  DATUM_NOT_USERDEF_ERROR         : Datum code is not user defined - cannot
00079  *                                    be deleted
00080  *
00081  *
00082  * REUSE NOTES
00083  *
00084  *    Datum is intended for reuse by any application that needs access to
00085  *    datum shift parameters relative to WGS 84.
00086  *
00087  *
00088  * REFERENCES
00089  *
00090  *    Further information on Datum can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00091  *
00092  *    Datum originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center (USATEC)
00093  *                             Geospatial Information Division (GID)
00094  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00095  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00096  *
00097  * LICENSES
00098  *
00099  *    None apply to this component.
00100  *
00101  * RESTRICTIONS
00102  *
00103  *    Datum has no restrictions.
00104  *
00105  * ENVIRONMENT
00106  *
00107  *    Datum was tested and certified in the following environments:
00108  *
00109  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00110  *    2. MS Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00111  *
00112  * MODIFICATIONS
00113  *
00114  *    Date              Description
00115  *    ----              -----------
00116  *    03/30/97          Original Code
00117  *    05/28/99          Added user-definable datums (for JMTK)
00118  *                      Added datum domain of validity checking (for JMTK)
00119  *                      Added datum shift accuracy calculation (for JMTK)
00120  *    06/27/06          Moved data files to data directory
00121  *    03-14-07          Original C++ Code
00122  */
00123 
00124

00163       /*
00164        * The function define3ParamDatum creates a new local (3-parameter) datum with the
00165        * specified code, name, and axes.  If the datum table has not been initialized,
00166        * the specified code is already in use, or a new version of the 3-param.dat
00167        * file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00168        * Note that the indexes of all datums in the datum table may be
00169        * changed by this function.
00170        *
00171        *   code          : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00172        *   name          : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00173        *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00174        *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00175        *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00176        *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00177        *   sigmaX        : Standard error in X in meters                 (input)
00178        *   sigmaY        : Standard error in Y in meters                 (input)
00179        *   sigmaZ        : Standard error in Z in meters                 (input)
00180        *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00181        *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00182        *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00183        *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00184        */
00185 
00186       void define3ParamDatum( const char *code, const char *name, const char *ellipsoidCode, 
00187                               double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00188                               double sigmaX, double sigmaY, double sigmaZ, 
00189                               double westLongitude, double eastLongitude, double southLatitude, double northLatitude );
00190 
00191 
00192       /*
00193        * The function define7ParamDatum creates a new local (7-parameter) datum with the
00194        * specified code, name, and axes.  If the datum table has not been initialized,
00195        * the specified code is already in use, or a new version of the 7-param.dat
00196        * file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00197        * Note that the indexes of all datums in the datum table may be
00198        * changed by this function.
00199        *
00200        *   code          : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00201        *   name          : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00202        *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00203        *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00204        *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00205        *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00206        *   rotationX     : X rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00207        *   rotationY     : Y rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00208        *   rotationZ     : Z rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00209        *   scale         : Scale factor                                  (input)
00210        */
00211 
00212       void define7ParamDatum( const char *code, const char *name, const char *ellipsoidCode, 
00213                               double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00214                               double rotationX, double rotationY, double rotationZ, 
00215                               double scale );
00216 
00217 
00218       /*
00219        * The function removeDatum deletes a local (3-parameter) datum with the
00220        * specified code.  If the datum table has not been initialized or a new
00221        * version of the 3-param.dat file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00222        * Note that the indexes of all datums
00223        * in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00224        *
00225        *   code           : 5-letter datum code.                      (input)
00226        *
00227        */
00228 
00229       void removeDatum( const char* code );
00230

00232       /*
00233        *  The function datumCount returns the number of Datums in the table
00234        *  if the table was initialized without error.
00235        *
00236        *  count        : number of datums in the datum table     (output)
00237        */
00238 
00239       void datumCount( long *count );

00242       /*
00243        *  The function datumIndex returns the index of the datum with the
00244        *  specified code.
00245        *
00246        *  code    : The datum code being searched for.                    (input)
00247        *  index   : The index of the datum in the table with the          (output)
00248        *              specified code.
00249        */
00250 
00251       void datumIndex( const char *code, long *index );
00252 
00253 
00254       /*
00255        *  The function datumCode returns the 5-letter code of the datum
00256        *  referenced by index.
00257        *
00258        *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00259        *  code    : The datum Code of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00260        */
00261 
00262       void datumCode( const long index, char *code );

00266        *  The function datumName returns the name of the datum referenced by

00269        *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00270        *  name    : The datum Name of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)

00272

00280        *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.          (input)
00281        *  code    : The ellipsoid code for the ellipsoid associated with    (output)
00282        *               the datum referenced by index.

00284

00290        *   for the datum referenced by index.
00291        *

00293        *    sigma_X    : Standard error in X in meters                   (output)

00295        *    sigma_Z    : Standard error in Z in meters                   (output)

00297

00301       /*
00302        *   The function datumSevenParameters returns parameter values, 
00303        *   used only by a seven parameter datum,
00304        *   for the datum referenced by index.
00305        *
00306        *    index       : The index of a given datum in the datum table. (input)
00307        *    rotationX   : X rotation in radians                          (output)
00308        *    rotationY   : Y rotation in radians                          (output)
00309        *    rotationZ   : Z rotation in radians                          (output)
00310        *    scaleFactor : Scale factor                                   (output)
00311        */
00312 
00313       void datumSevenParameters( const long index, double *rotationX, double *rotationY, double *rotationZ, double *scaleFactor);
00314

00320        *    index       : The index of a given datum in the datum table. (input)

00325

00327 
00328 
00329       /*
00330        *  The function datumShiftError returns the 90% horizontal (circular), vertical (linear), and
00331        *  spherical errors for a shift from the specified source datum to the
00332        *  specified destination datum at the specified location.
00333        *
00334        *  sourceIndex      : Index of source datum                                      (input)
00335        *  targetIndex      : Index of destination datum                                 (input)
00336        *  latitude         : Latitude of point being converted in radians               (input)
00337        *  longitude        : Longitude of point being converted in radians              (input)
00338        *  circularError90  : Combined 90% circular horizontal error in meters           (output)
00339        *  linearError90    : Combined 90% linear vertical error in meters               (output)
00340        *  sphericalError90 : Combined 90% spherical error in meters                     (output)
00341        */
00342 
00343       Accuracy* datumShiftError( const long sourceIndex, const long targetIndex, 
00344                             double longitude, double latitude, Accuracy* sourceAccuracy );
00345 
00346 
00347       /*
00348        *  The function datumUserDefined checks whether or not the specified datum is
00349        *  user defined. It returns 1 if the datum is user defined, and returns
00350        *  0 otherwise. If index is valid DATUM_NO_ERROR is returned, otherwise
00351        *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR is returned.
00352        *
00353        *    index    : Index of a given datum in the datum table (input)
00354        *    result   : Indicates whether specified datum is user defined (1)
00355        *               or not (0)                                (output)
00356        */
00357 
00358       void datumUserDefined( const long index, long *result );

00389        *  to the destination datum.

00399        *
00400        */

00409        *  local datum referenced by index.
00410        *
00411        *  WGS84X        : X coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
00412        *  WGS84Y        : Y coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
00413        *  WGS84Z        : Z coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
00414        *  targetIndex   : Index of destination datum                          (input)
00415        *  targetX       : X coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
00416        *  targetY       : Y coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
00417        *  targetZ       : Z coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
00418        */

00495       /*

00503

00505 
00506 
00507       /*
00508        *  The function validDatum checks whether or not the specified location is within the
00509        *  validity rectangle for the specified datum.  It returns zero if the specified
00510        *  location is NOT within the validity rectangle, and returns 1 otherwise.
00511        *
00512        *   index     : The index of a given datum in the datum table      (input)
00513        *   latitude  : Latitude of the location to be checked in radians  (input)
00514        *   longitude : Longitude of the location to be checked in radians (input)
00515        *   result    : Indicates whether location is inside (1) or outside (0)
00516        *               of the validity rectangle of the specified datum   (output)
00517        */
00518 
00519       void validDatum( const long index, double longitude, double latitude, long *result );
00520 
00521 
00522       /*
00523        *  The function setEllipsoidLibrary sets the ellipsoid library information
00524        *  which is needed to create datums and calculate datum shifts.
00525        *
00526        *   __ellipsoidLibrary  : Ellipsoid library      (input)
00527        *
00528        */
00529 
00530       void setEllipsoidLibraryImplementation( EllipsoidLibraryImplementation* __ellipsoidLibraryImplementation );

00562       /*
00563        * The function loadDatums creates the datum table from two external
00564        * files.  If an error occurs, the initialization stops and an error code is
00565        * returned.  This function must be called before any of the other functions
00566        * in this component.
00567        */

00586 
00587       /*
00588        *  The function geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72 shifts a geodetic coordinate (latitude, longitude in radians
00589        *  and height in meters) relative to WGS84 to a geodetic coordinate
00590        *  (latitude, longitude in radians and height in meters) relative to WGS72.
00591        *
00592        *  WGS84Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84    (input)
00593        *  WGS84Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84     (input)
00594        *  WGS84Height    : Height in meters  relative to WGS84       (input)
00595        *  WGS72Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS72    (output)
00596        *  WGS72Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS72     (output)
00597        *  WGS72Height    : Height in meters relative to WGS72        (output)
00598        */
00599 
00600       GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72( const double WGS84Longitude, const double WGS84Latitude, const double WGS84Height );
00601 
00602 
00603       /*
00604        *  The function geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84 shifts a geodetic coordinate (latitude, longitude in radians
00605        *  and height in meters) relative to WGS72 to a geodetic coordinate
00606        *  (latitude, longitude in radians and height in meters) relative to WGS84.
00607        *
00608        *  WGS72Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS72    (input)
00609        *  WGS72Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS72     (input)
00610        *  WGS72Height    : Height in meters relative to WGS72        (input)
00611        *  WGS84Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84    (output)
00612        *  WGS84Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84     (output)
00613        *  WGS84Height    : Height in meters  relative to WGS84       (output)
00614        */
00615 
00616       GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84( const double WGS72Longitude, const double WGS72Latitude, const double WGS72Height );
00617 
00618 
00619       /*
00620        *  The function geocentricShiftWGS84ToWGS72 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
00621        *  to WGS84 to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative to WGS72.
00622        *
00623        *  X_WGS84 : X coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
00624        *  Y_WGS84 : Y coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
00625        *  Z_WGS84 : Z coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
00626        *  X       : X coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
00627        *  Y       : Y coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
00628        *  Z       : Z coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
00629        */
00630 
00631       CartesianCoordinates* geocentricShiftWGS84ToWGS72( const double X_WGS84, const double Y_WGS84, const double Z_WGS84 );
00632 
00633 
00634       /*
00635        *  The function geocentricShiftWGS72ToWGS84 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
00636        *  to WGS72 to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative to WGS84.
00637        *
00638        *  X       : X coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
00639        *  Y       : Y coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
00640        *  Z       : Z coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
00641        *  X_WGS84 : X coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
00642        *  Y_WGS84 : Y coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
00643        *  Z_WGS84 : Z coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
00644        */
00645 
00646       CartesianCoordinates* geocentricShiftWGS72ToWGS84( const double X, const double Y, const double Z );
